page.title: 13DAISY HILL HOSPITAL
page.content:
{ Daisy Hill Hospital }
This hospital has served the people of this area for over one hundred and forty years.It started as a Workhouse. It was under the control of an elected Board of Guardians.They administered it and raised the levy under the eighteen thirtyeight Poor Law Act.The hospital facilites were severely tested shortly after its inception when rural Ireland was hit by The Potato Famine of 1845-1851. Daisy Hill survived this period and has continued to provide hospital services to this day.New buildings have now been developed and have replaced the original hospital and workhouse buildings.
